head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden ¶ 16/8/64 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to cause the byefollowing envelopes & wrapper papers to be stamped for the use of postal transmissions ...

div.p: G64/8137, unit 31, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to cause the byefollowing envelopes & wrapper papers to be stamped for the use of postal transmissions in this establishment. The number of envelopes herewith forwarded is

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

div.p: I have the honor to enquire, whether possibly any difficulty can arise by the new regulations in effecting communications with places beyond British possessions, it being expected in most instances that the letters should be free to the place of destination.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
&c&c&c
On 19 August 1864 Moore minuted: 'A franked Envelope will be treated in all respects as one carrying the requisite number of postage stamps.' See also J. Moore to M, 22 August 1864.
